initial_formation: Two lines facing each other about 6 feet apart; within each line dancers use Armenian hold (little fingers linked, hands at shoulder level, elbows bent down). One line is bride's side, the other groom's side.
coordinate_convention: Assume each line is roughly parallel to the x-axis; dancers face the opposite line along +y. 'Forward' (fwd/twd opp line) = +y; 'backward' (bkwd/away) = -y; side directions are dancer-relative (L = -x, R = +x).

steps.notes: No action. Begin with the drum (dumbeg). Maintain formation and Armenian hold.

steps.amount: Point L toe straight back, weight on R (ct 1)
Touch ball of L beside R, no weight (ct 2)
Repeat: point L toe straight back, weight on R (ct 1)
Repeat: touch ball of L beside R, no weight (ct 2)

steps.notes: Small, solid step; slight torso turn to R as L leads; head stays facing opposite person.

steps.amount: Close R to L, no weight (ct 2)
steps.notes: Continue advancing overall toward opposite line across measures.
Small, solid step; slight torso turn to L as R leads; head stays facing opposite person.

steps.amount: Close L to R, no weight (ct 2)
Repeat meas 3: step forward on L (ct 1)
Close R to L, no weight (ct 2)
Repeat meas 4: step forward on R (ct 1)
Close L to R, no weight (ct 2)
Small 'sinking' step back on L with toes turned left (ct 1)
steps.notes: Bend knee as step is taken; slight torso turn to L; keep looking at opposite person.

steps.amount: Repeat meas 7: small 'sinking' step back on L, toes turned left (ct 1)
steps.notes: Continue retreating away from opposite line.
Return to meas 1 (the 2-measure point/touch figure) after completing meas 8.

inferred_relations.notes: Two separate lines face each other ~6 feet apart; dancers maintain eye contact with the opposite person.
Armenian hold: little fingers linked, hands at shoulder level, elbows bent down.
Measures 3-6 advance toward opposite line; measures 7-8 retreat away; repeat.
